entries.content: When faced with criticism, acknowledge the point or the feeling behind it before providing your perspective or counter-argument.
entries.notes: Relates to Acknowledge step in frameworks like AAA or LAARC, or the Feel step in Feel-Felt-Found.

entries.content: Responding to the idea that her post was 'narcissistic' or 'victimhood' by first agreeing that victimhood can be narcissistic ('yeah I do actually believe that victimhood is quite narcissistic').
entries.notes: Example of the 'Agree' step in the AAA framework (Acknowledge, Agree, Answer).

entries.content: After acknowledging a criticism, differentiate your specific situation from the general point being made.
entries.notes: Part of structuring a response to an objection or criticism, following acknowledgement/agreement.

entries.content: Stating that her post 'wasn't a pulse of being a victim it was a post that I'm kicking ass' after agreeing that victimhood can be narcissistic.
entries.notes: Example of differentiating her situation as part of the 'Answer' step in AAA.

entries.content: Respond to criticism by focusing on your authentic values and achievements, rather than trying to fit others' expectations.
entries.notes: Part of the 'Answer' step in AAA - providing the rationale/alternative perspective.
